definition: victim (of a criminal)/party involved (in a dispute etc)/main instigator
owner/master/host/individual or party concerned/God/Lord/main/to indicate or signify/trump card (in card games)

sentences.english: There seems to have been some very faithful servants of Christ in the Ephesian church.
sentences.chinese: 特别是在以弗所的教会，更有很多忠心事主的信徒。

sentences.english: Following and serving the Lord is good.
Untold millions of believers have served him faithfully under despotic governments.
sentences.chinese: 数不清的信徒是在暴虐专横的政府之下忠心地服事主。

sentences.english: As we know how deep God loves us, we will serve Him the more. (
sentences.chinese: 我们会努力服事主，当我们知道他是那么爱我们。

sentences.english: I. Types of narrow-sense accusative subject sentence in newspaper news lead.
sentences.chinese: 报纸新闻导语狭义受事主语句的构成成分分析。

sentences.english: The name of the Personnel manager is John Adams.
Sue:Ah hello. I wonder if I could speak to the Personnel Manager, please?
sentences.chinese: 啊，你好。我想知道我是否能和人事主管说话？

sentences.english: They showed the resumes to a number of personnel directors.
sentences.chinese: 他们把这两份履历拿给了不同的人事主管看。

sentences.english: Since I gave my heart to Jesus, The longer I serve Him.
sentences.chinese: 从我把心呈献给主开始，我事主越恒久。

sentences.english: Those who love and serve God on earth will be right at home in heaven.
sentences.chinese: 在地上爱主事主的人，在天堂必会适得其所。

sentences.english: May I talk to the personnel supervisor?
sentences.chinese: 我能与人事主管谈谈吗？

definition: to report a case to the authorities
to sound an alarm/to report sth to the police
owner of sth lost or stolen
